intro: Scorzoneroides muelleri subsp. reboudiana, commonly known as the slender scorzoneroid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
